alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Nacogdoches; Rusk; Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 8:16PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Smith, southwestern Rusk, northwestern Nacogdoches and Cherokee Counties through 915 PM CDT... At 816 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of New Salem, or 13 miles southwest of Henderson, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tyler, Nacogdoches, Jacksonville, Henderson, Whitehouse, Rusk, Bullard, Troup, Alto, Berryville, Arp, Morrill, Ponta, New Salem, Trawick, Mount Selman, Joinerville, Sacul, Mixon and Turnertown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
